pullRequest.title: Implement `startAfter` for RTDB queries
pullRequest.bodyText:
go/rtdb-exclusive-query-filters
startAfter(value, key) means:
If key == undefined or null, startAt(value, MAX_NAME), else, startAt(value, key + 1), where + 1 means either the next integer (if the key is parseable as an int), or the lexicographically next key.

commit.message: Move lex logic in PushIdGenerator, fix tests

nodes.bodyText: Do you know what the 2 is meant to indicate? If not, I suggest we remove it from here and above.
The case number looks like it refers to an old bug about startAt, which is not applicable here. I would drop it (at least from here)
Same comment about case number.
s/inclusive/exclusive (and maybe s/at/after, but then I am no longer sure whether this is inclusive or exclusive)
Same as above
Same as above
We are well past version 2 now :)

+  /**
+   * Create a query constrained to only return child nodes with a value greater than the given
+   * value, using the given orderBy directive or priority as default.
+   *
+   * @param value The value to start at, inclusive
+   * @return A Query with the new constraint
+   */

+    return startAt(value, ChildKey.getMaxName().asString());
+  }

commit.message: Fix push id generation scheme, add test to detect breakage

nodes.bodyText: Can you explain why "d" is part of the result set when it has a priority of "w"?
There is also a 2 here as a suffix.
Also a 2 as a suffix.
Another strange suffix. If these are used to distinguish test cases, then we should come up with more specific names.
Please come up with a more specific test name.
Please fix.

nodes.bodyText: Nit: This is usually called a successor.
This looks like it could trigger an integer overflow. You could probably just use a long here, unless there are some specifications for valid keys that I am not aware of.

Nit: Flip assignments for clarity.
You could also refer to PUSH_CHARS and get the values from there (which will be slower and more code, so I am not sure it is actually worth it).
This is unused.
These changes don't seem to be needed.

commit.message: Return the proper value from successor

nodes.bodyText:
Totally optional:
s/WhenLimitIsHitFromFront/WhenDataEntersLimit
Here and below if you do update.
You don't need to convert num to long. In Java, long+int=long (and the int is treated as a long)
Optional nit: Remove empty line above.
Let's talk about this offline. My gut feeling is that this should match all results, since they order past null.
The expected state should come before the actual state. I think you need to flip the arguments everywhere.

commit.message:
Implement `endBefore` for RTDB queries (#2302)

* Implement `endBefore` for RTDB queries

* cleanup

* Fix bug in prevBefore

* Handle endBefore(..., Integer.MIN_VALUE)

* respect key ordering

* Add more tests, check key order boundary conditions

* Generate api text file

* Unit tests for predecessor

* cleanup
